CDoDWUnY1SN9RY6LI1en4A.text: Friendly staff, food quality high, but cooking variable.King Prawns to begin was an excellent choice, the Beef Carpaccio was nice but mean on meat, with more rocket than a rabbit could eat in a week.Spinach was gritty, courgettes lovely. My Bream was slightly overcooked, but the Monkfish was outstanding, and a huge portion.dessert menu limited and not didn't excite me at all.not perfect, but i'll definitely be back.

5PoOUqOd341089v_c9rYBw.text: Gem of a restaurant.  Cozy atmosphere, friendly family staff, and wonderful food.  Agree on the recommendation for the carpaccio from the prior reviewer.

XXy1b9e4US2vTDear0Kz_A.text: What a great find!  We were on vacation in London and wanted a restaurant near to where we were staying.  Il Portico came up in a search and upon reading the reviews we thought we'd give it a try.  We finished our touring and got to the restaurant about an hour early for our reservation.  We were welcomed with open arms and treated like we were regulars.  The food was sensational - as good as any Italian restaurant I'd ever been to (and coming from NY, I've been to plenty!)  The spaghetti with clam sauce was to die for!  If I'm ever in London again, I'd make it a point to go back - it was that good!

-0J3F5fVHwbjXIVnh__Lsw.text: Great value at this intimate italian restaurant. The place is small and always filled so definitely call for a reservation but its worth the wait. The food is fresh and yummy and surprisingly reasonable, given the neighborhood. we had two appetizers, two main courses, a bottle of wine, and a bottle of sparkling water for just about 75 gbp. our lunches can be as much! the filet carpaccio was delicious as well as the to-die-for homemade gorgonzola gnocchi. portions are just right and friendly service tops it off. i will definitely be back!

bPwWIOoxTQIKLZhcun38zw.text: When I moved to London for 5 months I said I wouldn't eat at the same place twice.  This place forced me to break my rules.  Having a wife who's near 100% Italian, I have to be picky with this stuff and Il Portico blew away my expectations (twice now).  You know the place is good when half of the patronage walking in knows the staff by name and is greeted with hugs and kisses.  That's loyalty, that's Italy, that's enough said.....

K1Nl6b4X4ilusLef8RzFUQ.text: We were visiting London for a week and found Il Portico on Yelp.  We found the staff and the food to be outstanding!  The atmosphere was great and the family members who owned the place were there and were just terrific.  I had the braised ox tail and it was delicious and the portion huge.  We will definitely be back to enjoy Il Portico when we get back to London and would give it our highest rating!

FRDv2T_0OvzorFLiNv4Zag.text: I love this place! The staff is always really nice and they serve genuine good Italian food. I recommend the king prawns as a starter :)

c4pOgtypCM-COivL6pwAUg.text: They have recently changed their menu and decor!  The place is even better than the the first time I visited here in January!  They have this incredible brick oven which equates to literally the best pizza you have ever tasted.  I brought a client of mine from Kensington and he raved that it was the best pizza he has ever had.  He was a vegetarian so I was hoping to impress with my choice for lunch.  The new menu is a little more complex and can't wait to try some of the authentic slow food options they offer.  Great job!  Love the new look!

ModBS2jlGKOqIi4jWvriDg.text: A fabulous place for an intimate Italian family meal with flavors that are fresh and amazing.

waIwO5C58Gpvr7xS4TjIBw.text: Great restaurant with lovely staff and delicious food. This small restaurant is very cozy and seems to be constantly packed with people. The servers are very attentive and welcoming and the food comes quickly. I especially liked their gorgonzola gnocchi dish, it was very rich but very tasty!

XELckMreID8Ro2Way3SX0Q.text: I was first at this restaurant 20 years ago when when I was young and on holiday with my parents from the States. I had been back many times in my travels to the U.K. and it was always my favorite restaurant in London. It been several years since I had been back and I wanted to take my husband to share a memory. I must say I was sadly disappointed. The service was subpar at best.I wasn't given a wine list until I asked what type of white wine they have.  No one ever bothered to tell us the specials,which I wouldn't have known they had except that I heard every other table be told them. The waitress who came to open our wine left to answer severely calls eventually asking another server to give us our wine because she had other things to attend to. It was obvious their regular customers were far more important, especially the owner who only paid attention to regulars and didn't even great us. The food itself as a whole was edible at best. You could cut glass with the bread it was so hard. Some times memories are best left in the past. I most certainly will never return to that dreadful place ever again. It is more than evident the new generation of owners has a different management style.Zev M. KramerPhiladelphia PA USA

gvcS0T7cJ36JylZ1_MY9cA.text: This place lives up to its reputation! The food was really incredible, especially the shrimp appetizer. Great pasta as well. Great ambience, very attentive service. Can't wait to go again.

HpfmI_r5UV_y1cQ4XVp6GQ.text: This unseasonably warm night started off in a hotel bar right off of Hyde Park.  I like the Kensington High street area, but aside from business dinners in hotel restaurants have never really had the opportunity to explore this area.  We had quite the mix of characters this evening.  An ex-pat American from Cleveland, an ex-pat Brussels based Italian, and me.  Having saturated ourselves in imported beer and wine in the hotel lobby bar meet up spot, we decided to hit the high street for something to eat.  I never really got the full story of how he knew the place (or if he even did), but our Italian friend walked us full-on into Il Portico.  The place was packed on a random Wednesday night, but a couple of words exchanged between our new found friend and the host landed us in a corner booth in the back with comped glasses of Prosecco in our hands.  Being that I'd been in London already for a couple of days, and obligated to attend work functions outside, and inside of the city for the past few nights made this especially comforting.  Just drinking and dinner relaxing with some old and new friends.  I'd been longing for a down-home, Italian comfort food meal since I landed, and this place fit the bill.  I started off with the caprese salad of caprese salads.  This not only had the requisite tomato, buffalo mozzarella, basil, and balsamic.  But also a healthy heap of prosciutto. When the spaghetti and clams arrived, although a staple and most pedestrian of Italian cusines, it immediately bought me a feeling of familiarity and content.  The group devoured this as our chosen pasta plates arrived.  My veal ravioli were delicious, delectable, and cooked to perfection.  And then for the main course, the veal saltimbocca was amazing.  For a city known to be expensive, Il Portico was definitely a value.  I'm not saying it's cheap, but for the value of the cosine, I'd definitely open my wallet again.  As I'm in this area fairly often, I'll be sure to make a return to Il Portico shortly.

33s70hnzA4X3uwmawzugVQ.text: I am not sure I can say anything that hasn't already been said.  Quite literally the best italian food and restaurant I have been to, including the ones in Italy!

G1YvDBdVkelOqMWypjxmFw.text: Amazing food and friendly service.  Was in London for business and stumbled into this restaurant.  They treat you like family there.  Had the risotto which was delicious!  very much recommend if are in the Kensington area.

tAvtLYmJ6f79EJQLb4pbmQ.text: Very nice Italian .... A small place, but comfortable. We were warmly received and shown to a table. The place was very busy, but the service attentive and nice. The food was well prepared. The asparagus delicious as were the king prawns. It's a 10-15 min walk from the high street Kensington tube stop in the circle line. Our waiter was nice enough to flag down a taxi for us when we left.

zG07YNGO_wrk5M5lP_Wteg.text: Sometimes I fall in love with places first time round, others talk me a little longer.For Il Portico, it was second time lucky.Almost a year since I last went in, we went back last night for what was one of the nicest, most authentic - and most delicious Italian meals of my life.Nestled at the end of High St Ken, Il Portico is small but perfectly formed. It's warm, inviting, and all of the staff are superbly polite and trained to perfection.Following the HUGE tasty olives and fresh-baked ciabatta we were given upon arrival, I had a king prawn starter for the second time. I can't recommend it enough. With garlic, herbs, lemon and a hint of chili, the sauce will have you asking for more bread and the seafood itself is top notch. Great portion size and something I'll have again in a heartbeat.Then I had the handmade pumpkin and ricotta tortellini, which were JUST as I hoped. Light, creamy and utterly divine.My other half had a lovely starter of what looked like a slice of a giant cannelloni, with meat ragu and bechamel sauce filling. It had all the flavours of lasagna, just in a different format. Taaaaaasty. Then he has steak with wild mushroom sauce (which the owner later told us were handpicked), which was also very, very good.We has beautiful wine to match and left happy, with the bill coming in at a very reasonable £82. I would have had a dessert but just wasn't that inspired by what was on offer, next time I hope there will be something to whet my appetite.

_TmrOurpcgwAW19XrFyaZA.text: I'm always searching for the comforting Italian that I know from Chicago. While I realize the UK doesn't have the same Italian immigration history as the US, I am still a little disappointed in the lack of basic Italian cuisine in London. And what I'm searching for is probably more of a hybrid Italian-American cuisine than anything--but that's beside the point, because I'm an American, and I want things how I want them (this is me trying to be a self-deprecating Yank).  Well, this past weekend I was introduced to a little Sicilian place in Kensington, that is very close to the mob-fronted, Italian-American places I know and love in Chicago. While it was a little warm inside, we stayed cool with a crisp bottle of trebbiano, grilled sardines, and beautiful prosciutto and mozzarella di bufala. For mains it was pasta, although I have it on good authority that the osso bucco is also quite good. The gnocchi was nicely chewy and drowning in heart-stopping amounts of cheese, while the linguine in squid ink was just as amazing. Lots of beautifully sautéed little fishes accompanied it. It was heavenly, and I can't wait to go back. Although next time I'll make a reservation ahead of time. We did have a little trouble getting in just after prime-dinner hour, but it gave us an excuse to check out the quirks of the neighbourhood. All in all, a very successful night!

Q01Yr_vec2xEaZz1pec6_Q.text: Very good Italian restaurant. I had the wild boar pasta dish and my wife had this chicken dish, both were good. They also had a good wine selection as well. The restaurant had a nice ambience to it. If you want Italian in London can't wrong with this place.

QUNtEOCXkpUvizfanisFMQ.text: Unexpected find. True Piacentini food. The veal preparations are authentic and very tasty. The pastas are well done. Service is very good and friendly. Any time in London I'll come here.

Hr15wIpPOdDWmWPhGQNMEA.text: Without doubt the best Italian in London... Staff friendliness is on a new level... But not gushing...

OuNHcNM3UBsjENRSGsx0ZA.text: We went to Il Portico for the New Year's Eve dinner and it was an overall good experience. The food was simple but well prepared, particularly the pasta dishes. The service was very courteous. It seemed that quite a few guests that night were regulars, so it's always a good sign. The prices were reasonable.

eZ9gq8yda6Kfw3y5o7pq9w.text: The traditional Italian soup was one of the best I have ever tried

Dg2gnbX5Lh7m4wsigUwr0g.text: I went to this restaurant with a party of four.  We all had different dishes- risotto, lamb, duck, and calves kidney- and each one was outstanding.  The sides were also exceptional, cooked perfectly and delicious.  We had broccoli and mashed potato.  Would definitely recommend and will return.

bau2gxL4Bw2FHZzqcg7mOA.text: One of the most enjoyable Italian dinners we've had in a long while.  Service, food and ambiance all were outstanding.  High Recommend!

SHJeL4JK2yNv-WzbtJeRhg.text: REALLY GOOD!  Great atmosphere.  Food and service were great.  We'll definitely be back next time we visit London.

jJe-koXrdHv3PK-HTpuXsQ.text: We had a long and lovely dinner here.  Fantastic service.  Felt like " our place" by the time we left.   Highly recommend.

zs6in2uinrrpfKeOQszlRg.text: Phen.Om.En.Al.Really great Italian, great staff, food arrived as it was cooked and tasted delicious.

Z0cQB5_rMIPJGBDvjLVONQ.text: Great prosciutto starter with a house wine! Wait staff were very friendly, very outgoing, and knowledgeable about the menu items. Gave great suggestions to our party of three.Sorry I didn't get pictures of the seafood spaghetti, however, it looked and tasted very good. I had a very delicious creamy pasta dish that went well with the wine. Would definitely go back and try other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Portico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Il Portico - London, United Kingdom

V5d_uOqUJIXa39osLAt6LQ.text: That feeling when you find a neat little place in a completely new and unknown environment but that still makes you feel comfortable and almost like home, ain't that great? That's just how I felt when we were having dinner at il portico the other night. The staff was super friendly and very attentive, coming up with great recommendations esp. on the wine. The menu is not huge in this place which I always interpret as confidence. The confidence that the chef believes in their handful of starters, primi and secondi. I have tasted the strozapretti and the tiramisu, both of which were incredibly tasty! I will definitely come back to this place the next time I will be in town again.

Pf-7EvscW60TiNdCtv1r6g.text: Excellent food and top notch service. We had spaghetti and veal as well as a selection of their mature cheeses - all of which were unbelievably delicious. Automatically one of my favourite Italian places in London.

Q4TKHro09YI-pZIIL4TPdw.text: Cozy and intimate ambiance with a nice selection of delicious food! Our server Vinnie was very helpful and efficient.

l4CRqLfvZYe2cOMi1JxW9w.text: Amazing one, the staff there are kind and helpful Can't wait to visit it again, don't forget to book your table first.You have to try prawns dish as a starter!The place is lovely.

C4CzY7tkQn9VIDqxPW_dWw.text: My favorite meal in London! This is an amazing Italian restaurant, great service, fresh food!

Y79vfc7FN6QAzRPsl2NW6g.text: Odd experience last night at Il Portico. Greeted by the staff when we arrived. Seated immediately. A couple of minutes later the woman at the front informed us that we would need to give up our table at 8pm. Since it was only 6:15p we were not bothered by this request but found it odd to be told that after being seated. Our waiter was attentive and friendly and the food was delicious! But our attention was often turned to the woman at the front who was visibly stressed about the pending reservation at 8pm. Not sure who she was expecting but every patron who entered after us was told the same thing about giving up their table. I'm sure this was just a fluke occurance so we would still return for another delicious meal.

Roa4JU5et6wi1wDxCx4wxw.text: Great food and service -- been here 4 times over my last 9 days here in UK -Fantastic service, good portions , delicious food!Had the veal , calamari, salad , lamb steak , spinach , French beans;  all very tastyStaff was exceptional at service , and accommodations

1W1Ra3z8cbRvWmTZZXnq9w.text: Wow.  What a meal!  My family had the best time / meal at Il Portico.  The staff was so friendly and the meal was delicious!  We were able to secure a table outside at 7:00pm on a beautiful July night.  We had burata to start, spaghetti with clams, risotto with snap peas, asparagus and butternut squash, Parpadelle with pork belly and veal Milanese.  All of it was outstanding!  Would highly recommend this play for a great meal and wonderful atmosphere.

hEu81BNbosgX9sed4IQWdw.text: I rate different areas of our expierence at the Il Portico to give you an idea why this place gets 5 stars from me.Service: I cant imagine a more lovely service. We arrived 30 minutes too early for our reservation. The main man ( I dont know if he is the owner) took my plus one and me to there other Restaurant 50 meters down the street to get a drink while we wait for our seats to be free.The barkeeper at this place than gave the Il Portico a call after 30 minutes to confirm our table is free now and we went back then. This is such a good service!Not to mention the huge efforts to make us feel very welcomeFood:The quality of the food, also in comparison to its price, is unbelievable.As starters we had the plate of different kinds of meat and a plate with different kinds of cheese. Our mains were a Risotto which was stunning and probably the best Pasta Bolognese I ever had!Place:The place is small and cozy. As someone mentioned before its like arriving at your own home place and having a dinner. If you fancy italian food you must have been at this place!

NYnoxoWhNLTjGD_0tgbiFA.text: There is something extremely comfortable and homely about Il Portico, like stepping into someone else's living room that looks just like a restaurant.The owners are Italian so the food is Italian which makes a lot of sense to me. I think I'd have been pretty shocked if the food was like, something weird, like Brazilian, but then I went through my mental database of Italian diaspora statistics and sure enough, like every one in Brazil is Italian so not that crazy.Very nice people run it, and the food is excellent, fresh and simple. Really a great neighbourhood spot.

s5rwjtutw5CgDT5wbFe1UA.text: Saturday night dinner with another couple - the service was attentive and family styled. The food was good but moderately expensive. I had the shrimp to start and it was quite good. For main course I had the lamb steak which was on special. Both dishes seemed quite good but a friend of ours had the risotto which was just a touch underdone. I also had the affogato for desert and shared a bottle of wine between the four of us. Came out to about 40 pounds per person. Not bad for a night out including 3 course meal and wine!

YRbPR_UR4nR8bsgkpuJx3g.text: The warmest reception ever by the staff. Just amazing. The asparagus and parmesan were great. Shared the shellfish linguini with the hubs and thought it was perfectly cooked. I had a fish dish with fennel and pink peppercorns after and thought it was lovely. Simple food but good.

HJIEE58AAXYy_M612ZKL7g.text: What an amazing find! My husband and I were visiting and craving some good Italian food, we really found a gem here. The place was packed when we arrived, so we were glad we made a reservation. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we made a reservation to come back the next night,Atmosphere- This is a cute neighborhood restaurant, nicely decorated with white tablecloths & outdoor seating.Staff- Very friendly! They all worked together as a team each one checking on us at different points in time refilling wine, water and such.Food- Delicious and home made with strong delicious flavors.  We started with the Sardines and they were perfectly cooked, salty and crisp at the same time. I had Pasta both nights, and each time the sauce was flavored well and perfectly cooked. My husband had the free range chicken, it was so good he ordered it two nights in a row. It was crisped on the outside and perfectly juicy on the inside.The only downside was when people started to smoke in the outside seating & the window is open smoke would blow in a little bit (we were seated near the window both nights). We closed the window and it was better.

kfiLn9U2Xs40T_iGyRPJyA.text: The service was terrific and authentic Italian. The calamari was the best I have ever had. Good wine selection. The Lamb Shank was unreal. The spaghetti had a generous serving of clams. The chocolate dessert was phenomenal. ABSOLUTELY go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Portico - London, United Kingdom. Spaghetti with healthy portion of clams.
Photo of Il Portico - London, United Kingdom. Lamb Shank Happiness.

g3KWVSFXNZXF_GYiWII1CQ.text: I came here with no idea where to go to eat. Used Yelp to find the highest rated restaurant near me and hiked the 1.5 miles not knowing what to expect.The experience was well worth it. Excellent service, presentation, and amazing food.

ub3bbjykFkw6_abSIUZE4Q.text: The best meal my wife and I ever had. Had the prawns for appetizer and they melted in my mouth. For entree I had the veal parmigiana with a side of handmade spaghetti and tomato sauce. The veal was so tender and the spaghetti was the best I ever had. My wife had the baby chicken and she said it was perfectly cooked and seasoned thought-out. For dessert we had the tiramisu and that was the perfect dessert to end the meal. They had great cocktails and the service was impeccable. I wanted to go back for lunch the next day but didn't have enough time. If you are in this area, you need to dine here. Hats off to the owners, servers and chefs.

hoJTk3J5MJhbqhm3MYtF-A.text: I generally refuse to eat Italian food (except pizza) because I am a traditionalist and always disappointed by restaurants claiming to be authentic. Il Portico, however, is an absolute exception. The staff are fantastic - everyone is smiling, everyone is personable, everyone wants to crack a joke, everyone is enjoying themselves that it just rubs off on you - and yet they do this all without compromising on efficient and attentive service.The Asparagi alla Parmigiana -Grilled asparagus with Parmigiano Reggiano gratin - were nice and crunchy with a thin layer of melted cheese on top. Simple yet tasty. The Prosciutto and Mozzarella plate was simple, but you could tell the prosciutto had been freshly sliced just then as it was light pink in colour with no dried edges. The Fusilli Ortolana - Fusilli with sundried tomatos,artichokes, and spring vegetable - was fresh, cooked perfectly al dente with just the right amount of vegetables and not overdone with sauce. The Gnocchi alla Sorrentina - homemade (yes! finally real ones!) gnocchi with tomato sugo, melted mozzarella and basil, baked in the oven - were divine. PERFECT gnocchi - not gummy, not too soft, not a factory-made shape. Beautiful in a simple tomato sauce laced with mozzarella cheese that didn't come out in globs.I will most definitely be returning.

PL6c6l76yRhh2PnPahatwg.text: IL Portico was by far the best meal we had in London (and we had some great meals). The lamb was perfect, my wife had the skate wing which was also amazing. Great selection of wines, wonderful staff, fantastic food, and delicious homemade gelato made this our new favorite in London. We will be back every time I am in London for business.
